page.title: 04Housing
page.content: In Saughall the older housing is built around 2 roads,one leading from Chester and the other running from East to West linked to the Wirral and to Wales.Behind these two roads a modern estate has been built. Mollington lies between two main roads leading to the Wirral and to Liverpool and Backford lies beyond the road to Liverpool.Over 90% of the housing in our area is owned by the occupants and there is no slum clearance. About 98% of the houses are made of red brick with a tiled roof whilst the remainder are of sandstone,pebbledash or are whitewashed.The housing is predominantly semi-detatched,followed numerically by detatched, bungalows, terraced property,farm house and cottages.Over 80% have garages.All homes have front and back gardens.
